isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 5000i and 9000i - RADIATOR, REMOVE AND REPLACE - RADIATOR AND COMPONENT REMOVal - RADIATOR

svcproc.title: RADIATOR
svcproc.para: Prior to removing the radiator, the assembly should be secured with lifting belts to prevent possible injury from radiator when loosening mounting bolts.

step1.para: Locate the two radiator stay rods, and loosen the assembly from the radiator frame.
Locate the radiator mounting bracket and mounting bushing on the side frame of the radiator shell on the passenger side ( Item 2, Figure 1).
Loosen and remove mounting bolts ( Figure 18) from mounting bracket and bushing. Follow same procedure on driver side.

figure.caption: Figure 18. Radiator Mounting Bracket And Bushing (Passenger Side Shown)

step1.para: Before lifting the radiator assembly, disconnect the stay rods, one from the radiator on the driver side, the other at the frame from the driver side.
Using a hoist ( Item 1, Figure 19) and the sling already attached to the radiator assembly, lift the radiator from the chassis frame rail.

figure.caption: Figure 19. Lift Radiator From Chassis Rail

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. SLING ATTACHED TO HOIST FOR RADIATOR LIFTING
